page.title: 02Longwell Green Wildlife
page.content: In our wildlife survey of 150 parents of Longwell Green Primary School 55 had seen foxes and 20 had seen{badgers in their gardens. Other mammals seen were hedgehogs,rabbits,bats,grey squirrels,weasels,rats,shrews and voles. The{badger's}set is in our school playing field. They go into gardens through holes in fences or hedges or by burrowing underneath.They are pests in the gardens by attacking rabbits in their hutch and digging holes.Other people attract badgers by putting down chocolate spread on bread, or cold potatoes and meat.This often brings them out during the daytime. They noticed older badgers make grunting noises while younger animals whine.
